item.title: Setup a local devenv with CoreDNS, SSH and Docker Swarm
item.description:
Image 1: Abstract overview of the setup
Working with docker in a local environment is great and can make a lot of dev things easier. With swarm you can even lump together all your machines and use all the ressource as one big view. There are a lot of possibilies, like setting up a swarm cluster on AWS or Digital Ocean in minutes and then deploy your services. This is straightforward.
